column2: Field Medic, Trauma Specialist, Biotechnician, Street Doc, Cyberdoc, Paramedic, Corpo Surgeon
column4: Scales 1–10; each rank improves ability to diagnose, treat, and perform surgery; unlocks advanced procedures at higher ranks (e.g., implant cyberware, perform organ transplants, rapid trauma response). Higher ranks decrease treatment/installation times and increase patient survival. See Special Notes for progression detail.
column5: First Aid, Diagnose Illness, Surgery, Pharmaceuticals, CyberTech, MedTech, Awareness/Notice, INT, TECH, EMP
column6: Cross-link to medtech_tools_table.tsv (medical scanners, surgical kits, trauma packs, cyberware installation gear); medical_supplies_table.tsv (pharma, blood, med supplies)
column7: Cross-link to medtech_npc_templates.tsv (Trauma Team Paramedic, Street Doc, Corpo Surgeon, Field Medic)
column8: Standard rank 1–10 (intern, resident, surgeon, trauma chief, etc.); advancement may also track organizational standing or street reputation
column9: NCPD Med Unit, Trauma Team Intl, Biotechnica, Arasaka Med, independent clinics, black clinics, nomad med caravans
column10: Access to surgical suites, ERs, trauma gear, cleanroom labs, restricted pharma, legal protection (with license), access to Trauma Team or emergency response
column11: netrunner trauma, corporate/fixer pressure, burnout, legal/ethical dilemmas, patient loss, infection risk, black market fallout, criminal liability
column12: Successful treatments, difficult surgeries, cyberware installations, pharmaceutical breakthroughs, invention/discovery, emergency saves
column13: Cross-link to medtech_jobs.tsv if available (emergency callouts, trauma response, cyberware installation, illegal operations, research, crisis triage)
column14: TECH + MedTech for all medical procedures; INT for diagnostics, EMP for bedside manner/patient compliance, Awareness/Notice for emergency triage
column15: MedTech (Medical Tech) is the special ability; each rank increases expertise and unlocks advanced medical actions (basic care at 1–2, surgery at 3+, cyberware at 5+, gene therapy at 8+ in V3). Higher ranks reduce installation/treatment time, boost survival/stabilization, and permit field improvisation. Installation times and legality: full installations require operating suite and proper gear; street/field jobs risk higher complication and legal liability. Restrictions: Certain cyberware/biotech is illegal or tightly regulated; trauma care may conflict with legal/ethical codes (e.g., working for criminals, fixing black market cyber). Subsystem: MedTech and CyberTech often interact for cyberware; edge cases include patient refusal, extreme trauma, and high-risk or exotic gear. Full mechanics, escalation, and disputed rules: see corebook and Cyberpunk V3.
